description: The United Kingdom in the dataset refers to England/Wales. In the United Kingdom, England and Wales were first to legalise same-sex marriage in 2013, Scotland followed in 2014, and Northern Ireland introduced its legalisation in 2019.

fields.description: Country values equal to 1 indicate same-sex marriage is legal, while values equal to 2 indicate some rights, such as civil partnerships/unions, have been granted to same-sex couples.

fields.name: Number of countries that have legalised same-sex marriage
fields.description:
The total number of countries that have legalised same-sex marriage over time. 

Note: The United Kingdom has been included as three separate entities: England/Wales, Northern Ireland, and Scotland as same-sex marriage was legalised in different years.
